programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: When a massive mid-winter storm tears across Alaska, Marty pushes his machine to the limit. Morgan and Margaret race to make the cut before the snow hits.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Animal helper Matt Wright and his team take on a dangerous challenge to ensure the survival of the saltwater crocodile. They must gather more than 20,000 unhatched eggs for relocation, but the fiercely protective reptilian mothers do not take well to their territory being invaded.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit the sites of famous American Civil War battles to unearth valuable and quirky collectibles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank bid for slot machines, old advertising and bears that have been stuffed and mounted.

programme.title: Grave Trade
programme.desc: The embalmers finally get to grips with a body that has spent the last three years stored in the mortuary, and Marcus prepares a lavish funeral for a local boxer.

programme.title: Grave Trade
programme.desc: John goes to Ghana to check on the funeral home he has set up there, while archaeologists investigate how immigration has shaped British history.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale and the team restore a rusty 1920s tyre-changer, and a baseball game from the 1940s is given an urgent makeover.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team repairs a 1967 dirt-road motorbike, while Tyler and Rick restore an airline flight sign.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Mancunian stand-up Jason Manford hosts the comedy show from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, and invites observational comic Michael McIntyre to take to the stage.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: A September 2012 edition of the topical comedy quiz show, as guests Greg Davies, Andi Osho and Stewart Francis join host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison to offer their take on the week's news stories.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Katherine Ryan takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton and stand-up and actress Cariad Lloyd joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Katy Brand, Ian Stone, Jack Dee and Lou Sanders, as they chat about chocolate, bomb scares and stag nights.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined by Dave Johns, Lucy Porter, Gemma Cairney and Reece Shearsmith to discuss weird celebrity encounters and good neighbours.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd learns he is being removed from the Cold Case unit. For his final job, he re-opens an investigation into the disappearance of 16 homeless teenagers between 1979 and 1982 - the first case he ever worked on. However, as the team struggles to find any new information, Grace worries about her colleague's reasons for revisiting his past - while a guilt-ridden Sarah becomes desperate to make amends for her role in Boyd's sacking. First part of the crime drama's two-part final story, starring Trevor Eve, with Paul McGann.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Peasant girl Tess Durbeyfield is encouraged by her father to seek advancement with their supposed relatives, the wealthy D'Urbervilles, and meets the charming Alec, man of the house since his father's death. He showers her with attention and gifts, promising her family will want for nothing - but as she soon discovers to her cost, there's a dark side to her persistent new suitor. Thomas Hardy adaptation, starring Gemma Arterton, Hans Matheson, Ian Puleston-Davies and Anna Massey.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron's work at the German PoW camp brings him into conflict with one of the prisoners, while Janet fears Dr Finlay's affection for a married patient could jeopardise his career. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Sky World Review & Business Report
programme.desc: The biggest stories from around the globe. Including weather, sports and business news.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Sky World Review & Business Report
programme.desc: The biggest stories from around the globe. Including weather, sports and business news.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura travels to Edinburgh to try to uncover the truth behind Andrew's wife's death, but finds more than she bargained for. Meanwhile, tensions between Tom and Katy reach breaking point as their secret threatens to surface. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura's resolve to bring Andrew to justice deepens and she enlists Tom's help in her plan. However, when a deception in her personal life comes to light, she is left with no one to turn to and resorts to dangerous methods to force Andrew's confession. But she is not alone in her mission. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt, Ioan Gruffudd and Warren Brown.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Bring Back...The Duets
programme.desc: We take a look back at some of the best duets ever, right here on Magic.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: The Kisstory Takeover
programme.desc: Kisstory is taking over with non-stop old skool and anthems.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The investigators are given a chance to explore a mysterious Nazi complex in the Argentinean jungle, and head to Berlin to examine evidence that Hitler could have faked his death.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The treasure hunters discovers more artefacts, leading ever closer to a valuable find. Plus, they meet a local historian who warns them that their objective has a cursed past.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his three Ferraris, a 1971 Daytona Coupe and a 1972 Dino GT to the Amelia Island auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Vehicle restorer Wayne Carini looks out for a BMW Isetta for his newly married daughter at the Bruce Weiner Microcar Museum sale.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage demonstrates what happens when a dog gets behind the wheel. Plus, rowdy races gone wrong, and an incredible dance-off on the highway.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Peculiar pedestrians take to the road, and reckless drivers throw caution in the wind. Plus, dash-cams continue to capture people behaving in inexplicable ways.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A magnesium fire results in a huge explosion, an F-18 fighter jet crashes on an aircraft carrier, and a motorcycle stunt ends in a spectacular crash.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An F-14 Tomcat explodes over the ocean, wind causes a pair of hydro-boats to crash, and a record-breaking car jump ends with the vehicle splitting in two.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics repair and revamp mum and Sunday school teacher Sarah's first car - a 1965 Buick Skylark Convertible.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: JT is almost 900lbs with a 100-lb lymphedema mass on his leg and a dangerous food addiction. When his girlfriend takes him to Houston, his behaviour drives her away.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases unravelled by forensic examiners, including the discovery of a woman's decapitated body by a fisherman and a reported suicide involving a toxic liquid.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: In a bizarre case apparently inspired by a TV show, an Illinois man commits a murder and fakes his own death in an attempt to cash in on his own life insurance policy.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 62-year-old Narleen Campton, who was found murdered in her home, apparently having been tortured, during Thanksgiving 2011 in Newport, Washington. Though Jeremy Bryant confessed to his involvement, doubt remains over whether he acted alone.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The trail of bank robbers who leave bombs at the scene of their crimes leads investigators to believe they are motivated by something other than money.

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: Officers are confronted by an angry dog owner brandishing a shotgun and an agent has to find an aggressive pit bull.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown gets hands-on with an angry alligator, a dehydrated puppy struggles, Lucky the cat swallows a large amount of human medication and a parrot is involved in a love triangle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides from Baltimore come to the bridal store for a joint appointment - but they have very different ideas, while new fashion director Randy is ready to make his mark.
